This is a beautiful and comfortable home to spend a few days in. We have no complaints what-so-ever about the house or property. My family was very comfortable sleeping and lounging around while on vacation. The kitchen is very well stocked with cooking equipment and spices if you choose to stay in. The bedrooms and bathrooms were equally well stocked and even had complementary single use soaps like you'd find in a hotel. The only things I'd have liked to know before renting were just how much traffic would be on the street in front of the house most of the day. You are right on the main road/highway in the area and will hear traffic from before sun up to late at night if you're in the front living areas. My wife and child said it didn't disturb their sleeping in the back bedroom or upstairs on the canal side, but you will hear traffic all day long out front. Secondly, if you're a fisherman like I am, know there will likely be water lilies covering most of the canal most of the day. They have a pretty purple flower, and seeing the plants very much fits the marshy feel of the area, but it almost prevents fishing in the canal out back. I had dreams of spending my free time casting for fish behind the property, and that was very much unrealistic. The water lilies float unattached to anything, so they move with the current and prevented casting all but perhaps 2 hours in the 3 days we were there. You can still drop bait straight down and fish under a bobber around the individual plants, or on bottom a few feet behind the back of the property, but you likely won't be able to cast and retrieve like almost all my fishing tackle required. We caught a few bluegill, Atlantic croaker, ladyfish, and even spanish mackerel on worms, shrimp, and crabs under bobbers out back, but I wasn't able to enjoy casting for a few hours here and there like I'd imagined. The crab traps were fun to use though and we were able to have a crab boil for supper our last evening thanks to them. It was very relaxing and enjoyable to sit on the back deck and watch the water. We watched several large 5-7 ft alligator gar swim by under the weeds, as well as many a shrimp and crab boat pass throughout the day. All in all I wouldn't hesitate to rent this house again or recommend it to others. The area still shows signs of the hurricane damage all over and this is one of the few very nice properties in that area.
